newsitem.title: UK: UK housing starts up 7 percent in 3 mths to Aug.
newsitem.headline: UK housing starts up 7 percent in 3 mths to Aug.

text.p: UK housing starts rose seven percent on a seasonally adjusted basis in the three months to August from the previous three months, while total completions were up two percent, the Department of Environment said.
In the latest three months, a total of 45,200 dwellings were started, down two percent from the same three months a year ago. Completions totalled 44,000 and were down nine percent from a year ago.
Private enterprise housing starts were up 11 percent in the three months to August from the previous three months, with completions up three percent.
Housing association starts of new dwellings in the three months to August were lower than in the previous three months while completions were unchanged.
Both starts and completions by local authorities and government departments remained at a low level, the DOE said.
